frame.name: Measurable_attributes
frame.definition:
<def-root>An <fen>Entity</fen> has a particular scalar <fen>Attribute</fen> with a value exceeding a contextually-specified or generally-understood standard. Except where there is a difference in FEs, we place all adjectives related to measurable quantities in this frame. Note that when an adjective appears with a quantity expression (e.g., <ment>6 feet long</ment>), it belongs to the Dimension frame.
<ex><fex name="Entity">That ladder</fex> is <fex name="Degree">really</fex> <t>tall</t>.</ex>
<ex>After his back injury, he won't lift <t>heavy</t> <fex name="Entity">boxes</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Entity
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Entity</fen> for which a particular gradable <fen>Attribute</fen> is appropriate and under consideration.
</def-root>

FE.name: Attribute
FE.definition: <def-root>The feature of an <fen>Entity</fen> which is under discussion.</def-root>

FE.name: Value
FE.definition: <def-root>A quantity or other characterization of the <fen>Entity</fen>'s state with respect to the <fen>Attribute</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Degree
FE.definition: <def-root>A modifier expressing the deviation of the <fen>Value</fen> from the norm.</def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Time</fen> during which the <fen>Entity</fen> is in the state of having a particular <fen>Value</fen> for the <fen>Attribute</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Circumstances
FE.definition: <def-root>Some specification of the circumstances under which the <fen>Entity</fen> has a particular <fen>Value</fen> for the <fen>Attribute</fen>.</def-root>
